title: Multiply by 2: factors up to 10
description: Practice multiplication facts for the 2 times table

questions.question: What is double 8?

title: Multiply by 3: factors up to 10
description: Practice multiplication facts for the 3 times table

questions.question: What is 3 groups of 6?

title: Multiply by 4: factors up to 10
description: Practice multiplication facts for the 4 times table

questions.question: How many legs do 7 dogs have?

title: Multiply by 5: factors up to 10
description: Practice multiplication facts for the 5 times table

questions.question: How many fingers on 6 hands?

title: Multiply by 6: factors up to 10
description: Practice multiplication facts for the 6 times table

questions.question: How many eggs in 6 half-dozens?

title: Multiply by 7: factors up to 10
description: Practice multiplication facts for the 7 times table

questions.question: How many days in 8 weeks?

title: Multiply by 8: factors up to 10
description: Practice multiplication facts for the 8 times table

questions.question: How many legs on 8 spiders?

title: Multiply by 9: factors up to 10
description: Practice multiplication facts for the 9 times table

questions.question: The 9s trick: 9 × 7 starts with what digit?
questions.hint: For 9 × n, tens digit is n-1, so 7-1=6

title: Multiply by 10: factors up to 12
description: Practice multiplication facts for the 10 times table

title: Mixed Multiplication Facts
description: Practice multiplication facts from all times tables

title: Divide by 2: quotients up to 10
description: Practice division facts for dividing by 2

questions.question: If 14 cookies are shared by 2 friends, how many each?

title: Divide by 3: quotients up to 10
description: Practice division facts for dividing by 3

questions.question: 24 marbles in 3 bags equally. How many per bag?

title: Divide by 4: quotients up to 10
description: Practice division facts for dividing by 4

questions.question: 28 stickers for 4 children equally. How many each?

title: Divide by 5: quotients up to 10
description: Practice division facts for dividing by 5

questions.question: 35 cents in nickels. How many nickels?

title: Divide by 6: quotients up to 10
description: Practice division facts for dividing by 6

questions.question: 42 eggs in cartons of 6. How many cartons?

title: Divide by 7, 8, and 9
description: Practice harder division facts

questions.question: 56 days is how many weeks?

title: Mixed Division Facts
description: Practice division facts from all divisors

title: Add 3-digit numbers without regrouping
description: Practice adding 3-digit numbers without carrying

questions.hint: Add each column from right to left

title: Add 3-digit numbers with regrouping
description: Practice adding 3-digit numbers with carrying

questions.hint: Add and carry when sum is 10 or more

title: Subtract 3-digit numbers without regrouping
description: Practice subtracting 3-digit numbers without borrowing

title: Subtract 3-digit numbers with regrouping
description: Practice subtracting 3-digit numbers with borrowing

title: Addition and Subtraction Word Problems
description: Solve real-world addition and subtraction problems
skill: Add and subtract within 1000 word problems

questions.question: A library has 456 books. They get 287 more. How many total?
Maria has 500 stickers. She gives away 175. How many left?
A train has 234 passengers. 158 more get on. How many now?
A school has 612 students. 189 are absent. How many present?
Tom read 145 pages. Then he read 267 more. Total pages?
A store had 800 apples. Sold 356. How many left?
Class A has 189 points. Class B has 276 points. Total?
A jar has 425 marbles. 178 are removed. How many left?
A bakery makes 356 cookies and 287 muffins. Total items?
Sam has 503 cards. He trades 249. How many now?
A farm has 267 cows and 385 sheep. How many animals?

title: Fractions: Parts of a Whole
description: Identify fractions as parts of a whole
skill: Identify fractions as parts of a whole

questions.question: A pizza is cut into 8 equal slices. You eat 3. What fraction did you eat?
A pie is cut into 6 equal pieces. 2 are eaten. What fraction is left?
A rectangle is divided into 4 equal parts. 1 is shaded. What fraction is shaded?
A circle is divided into 3 equal parts. 2 are colored. What fraction is colored?
In the fraction 5/8, what does the 8 represent?
questions.hint: The bottom number (denominator) shows total parts

questions.question: In the fraction 3/4, what does the 3 represent?
questions.hint: The top number (numerator) shows parts counted

questions.question: A shape has 5 equal parts. 4 are shaded. What fraction is NOT shaded?
What fraction of a week is 3 days?
questions.hint: A week has 7 days, so 3 days = 3/7

questions.question: What fraction of a dozen eggs is 5 eggs?
A bar is divided into 10 equal parts. 7 are colored. What fraction is colored?
8 out of 8 equal parts are shaded. What fraction is shaded?

title: Fractions on a Number Line
description: Locate and identify fractions on a number line
skill: Represent fractions on a number line

questions.question: On a number line from 0 to 1 divided into 4 equal parts, where is 1/4?
questions.hint: 1/4 is the first of four equal parts from 0

questions.question: On a number line from 0 to 1 divided into 2 parts, where is 1/2?
If 0 to 1 is divided into 8 equal parts, which fraction is at the 3rd mark?
On a number line, which is closer to 0: 1/4 or 3/4?
questions.hint: 1/4 is only 1 part from 0, while 3/4 is 3 parts

questions.question: If 0 to 1 is divided into 6 equal parts, what fraction is at the 6th mark?
questions.hint: 6/6 = 1 whole, at the end of the line

questions.question: On a number line from 0 to 1, which fraction is between 1/4 and 3/4?
Where is 0/4 on a number line from 0 to 1?
If each part on a number line is 1/3, how many parts from 0 to 1?
questions.hint: 3 parts of 1/3 each make a whole

questions.question: On a number line from 0 to 1 with 5 equal parts, what is at the 4th mark?
Which fraction is at the same point as 1 on a number line?
On a number line, 5/8 is between which two fractions?
questions.hint: 5/8 is more than 4/8 (1/2) but less than 8/8 (1)

title: Comparing Fractions
description: Compare fractions with same numerator or denominator
skill: Compare fractions with same numerator or denominator

questions.question: Which is larger: 3/4 or 1/4?
Which is larger: 1/3 or 1/5?
questions.hint: Same numerator: smaller denominator = larger pieces

questions.question: Which is larger: 5/8 or 3/8?
Which is larger: 2/6 or 2/4?
questions.hint: Same numerator: 4ths are bigger pieces than 6ths

questions.question: Which is larger: 1/2 or 1/8?
questions.hint: 1/2 is a much bigger piece than 1/8

questions.question: Which is smaller: 4/6 or 2/6?
Compare: 3/8 ○ 5/8
Compare: 1/4 ○ 1/6
Which is larger: 7/8 or 5/8?
Which is smaller: 3/4 or 3/8?
questions.hint: Same numerator: 8ths are smaller pieces than 4ths

questions.question: Compare: 6/6 ○ 4/6
questions.hint: 6/6 is a whole, which is more than 4/6

title: Equivalent Fractions
description: Recognize and generate simple equivalent fractions

questions.question: Which fraction equals 1/2?
Which fraction equals 2/4?
Which fraction equals 1/3?
Which fraction equals 3/6?
Which fraction equals 4/8?
Which fraction equals 6/8?
3/3 equals what whole number?
Which is NOT equivalent to 1/2?

title: Fractions and Whole Numbers
description: Express whole numbers as fractions and understand unit fractions

questions.question: How do you write 1 as a fraction with denominator 4?
How do you write 1 as a fraction with denominator 6?
What whole number does 8/8 equal?
What whole number does 3/1 equal?
How many 1/4s make a whole?
How many 1/3s make a whole?
How many 1/8s make a whole?
Which is greater: 1 or 5/6?
Which is greater: 7/4 or 1?
What is 6/1?
questions.hint: Any number divided by 1 equals itself

title: Introduction to Area
description: Understand area as covering a shape with unit squares
skill: Understand area as covering with unit squares

questions.question: What is area?
questions.hint: Area measures the space inside a flat shape

questions.question: Area is measured in what units?
questions.hint: Area uses square units (sq in, sq cm, etc.)

questions.question: A rectangle is covered by 12 unit squares. What is its area?
questions.hint: Count the unit squares to find area

questions.question: A shape is covered by 8 unit squares. What is its area?
Which has more area: a shape with 15 unit squares or 10 unit squares?
A rectangle has 4 rows of 5 unit squares. What is its area?
A square has 3 rows of 3 unit squares. What is its area?
Two rectangles both have area 12 sq units. Must they be the same shape?
questions.hint: 3×4 and 2×6 both equal 12 but look different

questions.question: A rectangle has 2 rows of 7 unit squares. What is its area?
Which unit would you use for the area of a book cover?
questions.hint: Area is always in square units

questions.question: A rectangle is 5 units by 6 units. What is its area?

title: Area of Rectangles
description: Calculate area using length × width
skill: Calculate area of rectangles using multiplication

questions.question: A rectangle is 4 cm by 6 cm. What is its area?
A rectangle is 5 in by 7 in. What is its area?
A square has sides of 8 m. What is its area?
A rectangle is 9 ft by 3 ft. What is its area?
A rectangle is 10 cm by 4 cm. What is its area?
A square has sides of 6 in. What is its area?
A rectangle is 8 m by 5 m. What is its area?
A rectangle is 7 cm by 7 cm. What is its area?
A rug is 3 ft by 9 ft. What is its area?
A garden is 6 m by 8 m. What is its area?
Which formula gives the area of a rectangle?

title: Introduction to Perimeter
description: Understand perimeter as distance around a shape

questions.question: What is perimeter?
questions.hint: Perimeter is the distance around a shape

questions.question: How do you find perimeter?
questions.hint: Perimeter = sum of all side lengths

questions.question: A triangle has sides 3, 4, and 5. What is its perimeter?
A square has sides of 5 cm each. What is its perimeter?
Perimeter is measured in what units?
questions.hint: Perimeter uses length units (cm, m, in, ft)

questions.question: A rectangle has sides 6 and 4. What is its perimeter?
A pentagon has 5 equal sides of 3 cm. What is its perimeter?
Which is perimeter: walking around a field or covering a field with grass?
questions.hint: Perimeter is the distance around (like a fence)

questions.question: A square has perimeter 24 cm. What is each side?
A triangle has equal sides. If perimeter is 18 m, what is each side?
A hexagon has 6 equal sides of 2 in. What is its perimeter?

title: Perimeter of Rectangles
description: Calculate perimeter of rectangles and squares

questions.question: A rectangle is 8 cm by 5 cm. What is its perimeter?
A rectangle is 10 in by 4 in. What is its perimeter?
A square has sides of 9 m. What is its perimeter?
A rectangle is 7 ft by 3 ft. What is its perimeter?
A rectangle is 12 cm by 6 cm. What is its perimeter?
A square has sides of 11 in. What is its perimeter?
A rectangle is 9 m by 6 m. What is its perimeter?
A picture frame is 5 in by 7 in. How much frame material is needed?
A fence around a square garden with 8 m sides needs how many meters?
A rectangle has perimeter 30 cm. If length is 10 cm, what is width?
Which formula gives perimeter of a rectangle?

title: Tell Time to the Minute
description: Read clocks and tell time to the nearest minute
skill: Tell and write time to the nearest minute

questions.question: If the minute hand points to 3, how many minutes past the hour?
If the minute hand points to 7, how many minutes past the hour?
What time is 25 minutes after 2:00?
What time is 47 minutes after 5:00?
If a clock shows 3:18, how many minutes past 3?
What time is it when the hour hand is between 8 and 9, and minute hand on 11?
How many minutes from 4:35 to 5:00?
What time is 10 minutes before 9:00?
If it's 7:42, what will time be in 15 minutes?
What time is quarter past 6?
What time is quarter to 10?
questions.hint: Quarter to = 15 minutes before = 45 minutes past previous hour

title: Elapsed Time
description: Calculate elapsed time in hours and minutes

questions.question: From 2:00 to 5:00, how much time passed?
From 8:30 to 9:30, how much time passed?
questions.hint: Same minutes, one hour apart = 1 hour

questions.question: From 3:15 to 3:45, how much time passed?
A movie starts at 4:00 and ends at 6:30. How long is it?
questions.hint: 4:00 to 6:00 = 2 hr, plus 30 min = 2 hr 30 min

questions.question: From 11:00 AM to 2:00 PM, how much time passed?
School starts at 8:15 and ends at 3:15. How long is the school day?
A game starts at 1:30 and lasts 2 hours. What time does it end?
From 9:45 to 10:30, how much time passed?
Practice starts at 4:15 and lasts 1 hour 30 minutes. End time?
From 7:20 to 8:05, how much time passed?
A trip takes 3 hours 15 minutes. If you leave at 10:00, when do you arrive?

title: A.M. and P.M.
description: Understand and use A.M. and P.M. correctly

questions.question: Which time is in the morning: 8:00 A.M. or 8:00 P.M.?
Which time is in the evening: 6:00 A.M. or 6:00 P.M.?
questions.hint: P.M. = afternoon and evening (noon to midnight)

questions.question: When do most people eat breakfast?
When do most people eat dinner?
What does A.M. stand for?
What does P.M. stand for?
When is noon?
When is midnight?
School usually starts at what time?
Most people sleep at what time?
questions.hint: Bedtime is usually in the evening (P.M.)

questions.question: 3:00 in the afternoon is written as:

title: Reading Bar Graphs
description: Read and interpret data from bar graphs

questions.question: In a bar graph, what does the height of a bar show?
A bar graph shows: Red=5, Blue=8, Green=3. Which color has the most?
questions.hint: Blue has 8, which is the largest number

questions.question: A bar graph shows: Apples=12, Oranges=8, Bananas=10. How many more apples than oranges?
In a bar graph, the scale goes 0, 2, 4, 6... A bar reaches 6. What's the value?
questions.hint: Read where the bar ends on the scale

questions.question: A bar graph shows votes: Pizza=15, Tacos=10, Burgers=12. Total votes?
A bar reaches halfway between 4 and 6 on the scale. What's the value?
A bar graph shows: Dogs=7, Cats=9, Birds=4. Which pet is least popular?
If the scale is 0, 5, 10, 15... and a bar reaches 10, what's the value?
questions.hint: Read the value where the bar stops

questions.question: A bar graph shows: Monday=6, Tuesday=4, Wednesday=8. Average (mean)?
Two bars show 12 and 8. What is their difference?
A bar graph has scale by 5s. A bar is between 15 and 20. What could it be?
questions.hint: Between 15 and 20, so could be 16, 17, 18, or 19

title: Reading Picture Graphs
description: Read and interpret data from picture graphs (pictographs)

questions.question: In a pictograph, each ★ = 2. If a row shows ★★★, what is the value?
Each 🍎 = 5 apples. A row shows 🍎🍎🍎🍎. How many apples?
Each symbol = 10. A row has 3 symbols. What's the total?
Each 📚 = 2 books. Ann has 📚📚📚, Ben has 📚📚. How many more does Ann have?
If half a symbol = half the value, and ☀ = 4, what does ☀ with half show?
Each 🌟 = 5. Row A: 🌟🌟🌟, Row B: 🌟🌟🌟🌟. Total of both rows?
Each 🎈 = 3 balloons. To show 12 balloons, how many 🎈 symbols needed?
Each ⭐ = 10 points. Team A: ⭐⭐⭐, Team B: ⭐⭐. Difference?
Each symbol = 4. A row shows 5 symbols. What's the value?
Key says each 🐱 = 3 cats. To show 9 cats, how many symbols?
Each 🚗 = 5 cars. Row shows 🚗🚗 and half 🚗. How many cars?

title: Asking Questions About Data
description: Generate questions and draw conclusions from data sets

questions.question: Favorite fruits: Apples=12, Bananas=8, Oranges=10. How many students voted?
Books read: Week 1=5, Week 2=7, Week 3=6. Which week had the most?
questions.hint: Week 2 had 7, which is the highest

questions.question: Pet survey: Dogs=15, Cats=12, Fish=8. How many more dogs than fish?
Scores: Test 1=85, Test 2=90, Test 3=88. What's the range?
Weather: Sunny=10 days, Rainy=5 days, Cloudy=8 days. Total days recorded?
Sports: Soccer=20, Basketball=15, Baseball=10. What fraction chose soccer?
Heights: 48 in, 52 in, 50 in, 46 in. What's the tallest height?
Stickers earned: Mon=4, Tue=6, Wed=5, Thu=3, Fri=7. Busiest day?
Sales: Jan=100, Feb=80, Mar=120. How much more in Mar than Feb?
Coins: Pennies=25, Nickels=10, Dimes=15. What's the mode (most common)?
questions.hint: Mode is the most frequent. Pennies (25) is the largest count

questions.question: If Red=8, Blue=12, Green=8, which colors have the same amount?

title: Classifying Quadrilaterals
description: Identify and classify quadrilaterals by their properties

questions.question: How many sides does a quadrilateral have?
A shape has 4 equal sides and 4 right angles. What is it?
A shape has 4 right angles but sides are not all equal. What is it?
questions.hint: Right angles but different side lengths = rectangle

questions.question: A shape has 4 equal sides but no right angles. What is it?
questions.hint: Equal sides but tilted (no right angles) = rhombus

questions.question: Which quadrilateral has exactly one pair of parallel sides?
questions.hint: Trapezoid has one pair of parallel sides

questions.question: Is a square also a rectangle?
questions.hint: A square has all rectangle properties plus equal sides

questions.question: Is a rectangle also a square?
questions.hint: Only if all sides are equal (then it's a square)

questions.question: How many right angles does a rectangle have?
questions.hint: All 4 corners of a rectangle are right angles

questions.question: Which shape is NOT a quadrilateral?
A parallelogram has how many pairs of parallel sides?
questions.hint: Parallelogram has 2 pairs of parallel sides

questions.question: Which quadrilateral has 4 equal sides?
questions.hint: Both square and rhombus have 4 equal sides

title: Partitioning Shapes
description: Divide shapes into equal parts and relate to fractions

questions.question: A rectangle is divided into 4 equal parts. Each part is what fraction?
A circle is divided into 6 equal parts. Each part is what fraction?
A square is divided in half. How many equal parts?
A pie is cut into 8 equal slices. What fraction is 3 slices?
To divide a rectangle into thirds, how many lines do you draw?
A shape is divided into 5 equal parts. 2 are shaded. What fraction is shaded?
To divide a circle into quarters, how many lines through the center?
questions.hint: 2 lines through center make 4 equal parts

questions.question: A rectangle is divided into 3 equal rows and 2 equal columns. How many parts?
If a shape has 8 equal parts and 8 are shaded, what fraction is shaded?
A square is divided into 4 equal triangles. What fraction is each triangle?
To show 2/3 of a rectangle, divide into 3 parts and shade how many?

title: Shape Attributes
description: Describe shapes by their attributes (sides, angles, vertices)

questions.question: What is a vertex?
questions.hint: Vertex = corner where two sides meet

questions.question: How many vertices does a triangle have?
How many vertices does a rectangle have?
A pentagon has how many sides?
A hexagon has how many sides?
An octagon has how many sides?
What type of angle is in the corner of a square?
An angle smaller than a right angle is called:
An angle larger than a right angle is called:
Does a circle have vertices?
A shape has 3 sides and 3 vertices. What is it?

title: Multiplication Word Problems
description: Solve real-world problems using multiplication

questions.question: Each box has 6 crayons. How many crayons in 4 boxes?
A spider has 8 legs. How many legs do 5 spiders have?
Each row has 7 chairs. There are 6 rows. How many chairs total?
A pack has 5 gum pieces. How many pieces in 9 packs?
Each shelf holds 8 books. How many books on 7 shelves?
A car has 4 wheels. How many wheels on 9 cars?
Each bag has 3 apples. How many apples in 8 bags?
A week has 7 days. How many days in 4 weeks?
Each page has 9 stickers. How many stickers on 6 pages?
A hand has 5 fingers. How many fingers on 8 hands?
Each team has 6 players. How many players on 7 teams?

title: Division Word Problems
description: Solve real-world problems using division

questions.question: 24 cookies shared equally among 6 friends. How many each?
35 pencils in 5 equal groups. How many per group?
48 students in 8 equal teams. How many per team?
42 marbles shared among 7 children. How many each?
27 flowers in vases with 9 flowers each. How many vases?
56 cards dealt to 8 players equally. How many each?
30 books on 6 equal shelves. How many per shelf?
36 muffins in boxes of 4. How many boxes?
63 photos in albums with 9 photos each. How many albums?
45 minutes for 5 activities. How many minutes each?
32 students in 4 equal lines. How many per line?

title: Relationship Between Multiplication and Division
description: Understand how multiplication and division are related
skill: Use multiplication to solve division problems

questions.question: If 6 × 7 = 42, then 42 ÷ 7 = ?
questions.hint: Multiplication and division are inverse operations

questions.question: If 8 × 5 = 40, then 40 ÷ 8 = ?
questions.hint: If a × b = c, then c ÷ a = b

questions.question: If 9 × 4 = 36, then 36 ÷ 4 = ?
questions.hint: Use the multiplication fact to find the division answer

questions.question: If 7 × 8 = 56, what is 56 ÷ 8?
If 5 × 9 = 45, what is 45 ÷ 5?
Which multiplication helps solve 54 ÷ 6?
Which multiplication helps solve 72 ÷ 9?
What are the fact family members for 3, 8, and 24?
questions.hint: Fact families have 2 multiplication and 2 division facts

questions.question: Complete the fact family: 7 × 9 = 63, 9 × 7 = 63, 63 ÷ 7 = 9, __ = __

title: Properties of Multiplication
description: Understand commutative, associative, and distributive properties

questions.question: If 4 × 7 = 28, what is 7 × 4?
Which property says 3 × 5 = 5 × 3?
What is 6 × 0?
What is 8 × 1?
questions.hint: Identity property: any number × 1 = that number

questions.question: Which equals (2 × 3) × 4?
To find 6 × 8, you can add 6 × 5 and 6 × 3. Why?
What property does 1 × 9 = 9 show?
7 × 3 = 3 × 7. This is called the ___ property.
What is 15 × 0 × 100?
questions.hint: If any factor is 0, the product is 0

title: Rounding and Estimation
description: Round numbers and estimate sums and differences
skill: Round to nearest 10 or 100 and estimate

questions.question: Round 47 to the nearest 10
Round 83 to the nearest 10
Round 256 to the nearest 100
Round 341 to the nearest 100
Round 75 to the nearest 10
Estimate 48 + 31 by rounding to nearest 10
Estimate 87 - 42 by rounding to nearest 10
Estimate 523 + 289 by rounding to nearest 100
Round 649 to the nearest 100
Estimate 76 × 4 by rounding 76 to nearest 10
Is 52 closer to 50 or 60?
questions.hint: 52 is only 2 away from 50, but 8 away from 60

title: Number Patterns and Sequences
description: Identify and continue arithmetic patterns

questions.question: Continue: 3, 6, 9, 12, __
What is the rule for: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10?
questions.hint: Each number is 2 more than the last

questions.question: What is the rule for: 50, 45, 40, 35?
questions.hint: Each number is 5 less than the last

questions.question: Find the missing number: 12, __, 24, 30, 36
What is the 6th number: 9, 18, 27, 36, 45, __
Continue backwards: 48, 42, 36, 30, __

title: Odd and Even Numbers
description: Identify odd and even numbers and their properties

questions.question: Is 24 odd or even?
Is 37 odd or even?
Which number is even: 15, 28, 43, 71?
Which number is odd: 12, 36, 47, 80?
Even + Even = ?
Odd + Odd = ?
Even + Odd = ?
Even × Even = ?
Is 100 odd or even?
How many even numbers from 1 to 10?
Is 0 odd or even?
questions.hint: 0 is considered even (0 ÷ 2 = 0 with no remainder)

title: Area of Composite Shapes
description: Find area by decomposing into rectangles

questions.question: An L-shape is made of a 4×3 rectangle and a 2×3 rectangle. Total area?
A shape is made of two 5×2 rectangles. Total area?
A 6×4 rectangle has a 2×2 square cut out. Remaining area?
Two squares: one is 3×3, one is 4×4. Combined area?
A T-shape: 6×2 rectangle on top of a 2×4 rectangle. Total area?
To find area of an L-shape, you should:
questions.hint: Decompose complex shapes into simple rectangles

questions.question: A shape is 8×5 with a 3×3 square removed. What's the area?
An H-shape: two 2×5 rectangles connected by a 4×2 rectangle. Total area?
A 5×5 square with a 2×3 rectangle attached. Total area?
A room is 10×8 with a 3×3 closet. What's the room area without closet?
Two touching rectangles: 4×6 and 4×3. Total area?

title: Measuring Mass and Weight
description: Estimate and measure mass in grams and kilograms
skill: Measure mass in grams and kilograms

questions.question: How many grams in 1 kilogram?
Which is heavier: 500 g or 1 kg?
questions.hint: 1 kg = 1000 g, which is more than 500 g

questions.question: A paperclip weighs about how much?
questions.hint: Very light objects are measured in grams

questions.question: A watermelon weighs about how much?
3 kg = ? grams
Which unit for measuring a dog's weight?
Which unit for measuring flour for cookies?
questions.hint: Small amounts of ingredients use grams

questions.question: A book weighs about 500 g. 2 books weigh?
2 kg 500 g = ? grams
Which is lighter: 1500 g or 2 kg?
questions.hint: 2 kg = 2000 g, which is more than 1500 g

title: Measuring Capacity (Volume of Liquids)
description: Estimate and measure liquid volume in liters and milliliters
skill: Measure liquid volume in liters and milliliters

questions.question: How many milliliters in 1 liter?
A water bottle holds about how much?
questions.hint: A typical water bottle is about 500 mL or half a liter

questions.question: A bathtub holds about how much?
2 L = ? mL
A teaspoon holds about how much?
Which is more: 1 L or 800 mL?
questions.hint: 1 L = 1000 mL, which is more than 800 mL

questions.question: A fish tank holds 20 L. That's how many mL?
Which unit for measuring juice in a glass?
questions.hint: A glass holds a few hundred milliliters

questions.question: 1 L 250 mL = ? mL
Which is less: 2500 mL or 3 L?
questions.hint: 3 L = 3000 mL, which is more than 2500 mL
